Change is Coming…

February 28th, 2006 · 3 Comments

10 years ago, VB was the easy way to write IT applications.Â  5 years ago, many new IT applications moved to a server-side model with J2EE or PHP.Â  The next big change is around the corner and it has been spurned on by the advent of AJAX.Â  Simply put, server-side applications are just too hard to write and interact with.Â  Ruby on Rails has optimized server-side application development to the point where most of my time is no longer spent on writing application logic but presentation code: dealing with HTML, CSS and horribly limited form widgets which haven’t changed in 10 years.

So the next big change is a merging of the best parts of each application style: a rich client interface with the centralization afforded by a browser-based client.Â  This is the promise of Flash but it is expensive and does not play well with the traditional Web interface.Â  Who’s going to lead this vanguard?Â  I don’t know but I suspect one should keep an eye out for open source projects gaining traction…Â  ZX? OpenLaszlo? Echo2?Â  All are next-gen web app frameworks with benefits and drawbacks.Â  I just want to see a browser-based framework which allows for more complex UI widgets like trees and tables.
